test_message: Process expense submission: Employee John Doe (ID: EMP-12345) uploaded a dinner receipt for $85.50 from Restaurant ABC on 2026-01-15. Category: Meals. Employee location: Zurich office. Receipt shows clear itemization with date, merchant name, and total amount visible.

violations.description: The dinner expense amount of $85.50 exceeds the standard per-person dinner limit (typically $75.00) for the Zurich office location.
Dinner expense incurred in Zurich requires validation that the employee was scheduled to work late or was traveling for business; no travel authorization found.
Employee has access to Zurich staff restaurant; on-site restaurant meals are not reimbursable without late work or exceptional approval.

escalation_reasons: Expense exceeds meal spending limit for Zurich office.
No travel authorization or late work assignment for dinner expense.
Submitted meal ineligible due to on-site restaurant access at Zurich office.
result.aggregated_recommendation: The receipt is authentic, but the expense breaches company meal policy and business eligibility rules (spending limit and no exceptional approval for on-site meal). Rejection is mandated.
next_steps: Notify employee of rejection and provide reasons.
Advise on Zurich meal reimbursement policies and the need for pre-authorization or documentation for exceptions.
No escalation required as violations are clear-cut.
